New Records: Sri Lanka bowled out for 77, their lowest total in T20I history
Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 7 runs, a standout performance in the match
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka's batting lineup collapsed for a record low in T20I history, scoring just 77 runs against South Africa
Anrich Nortje's devastating spell saw him take 4 wickets for just 7 runs
Ottneil Baartman claimed a wicket with his very first delivery and maintained an impressive economy rate of 2.25
Keshav Maharaj took two wickets in consecutive balls, further dismantling the Sri Lankan batting lineup
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's performance was far from the level expected in such a critical match
The team's inability to build partnerships or counter the South African bowlers' tactics was evident
This historic low for Sri Lanka in T20I cricket raises questions about their preparation and adaptability
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York pitch, being used for the first time in this tournament, proved challenging for the batsmen with inconsistent bounce and swing
Sri Lanka's score of 77 is the fifth-lowest by a full-member team in T20 World Cup history
